refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GQueue structure and its associated functions provide a standard queue data structure. Internally, GQueue uses the same data structure as GList to store elements.
As with all other GLib data structures, GQueue is not thread-safe. For a thread-safe queue, use GAsyncQueue.
To create a new GQueue, use g_queue_new().
To initialize a statically-allocated GQueue, use G_QUEUE_INIT or g_queue_init().
To add elements, use g_queue_push_head(), g_queue_push_head_link(), g_queue_push_tail() and g_queue_push_tail_link().
To remove elements, use g_queue_pop_head() and g_queue_pop_tail().
To free the entire queue, use g_queue_free().

refsect2.title: g_queue_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GQueue.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a newly allocated GQueue

refsect2.title: g_queue_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees the memory allocated for the GQueue. Only call this function if queue was created with g_queue_new(). If queue elements contain dynamically-allocated memory, they should be freed first.
If queue elements contain dynamically-allocated memory, you should either use g_queue_free_full() or free them manually first.

refsect2.title: g_queue_free_full ()
refsect2.para: Convenience method, which frees all the memory used by a GQueue, and calls the specified destroy function on every element's data.
free_func should not modify the queue (eg, by removing the freed element from it).

entry.para: the function to be called to free each element's data

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: g_queue_init ()
refsect2.para: A statically-allocated GQueue must be initialized with this function before it can be used. Alternatively you can initialize it with G_QUEUE_INIT. It is not necessary to initialize queues created with g_queue_new().
Since: 2.14

refsect2.title: g_queue_clear ()
refsect2.para: Removes all the elements in queue . If queue elements contain dynamically-allocated memory, they should be freed first.
Since: 2.14

refsect2.title: g_queue_is_empty ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the queue is empty.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the queue is empty

refsect2.title: g_queue_get_length ()
refsect2.para: Returns the number of items in queue .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the number of items in queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_reverse ()
refsect2.para: Reverses the order of the items in queue .
Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_copy ()
refsect2.para: Copies a queue . Note that is a shallow copy. If the elements in the queue consist of pointers to data, the pointers are copied, but the actual data is not.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a copy of queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_foreach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_queue_foreach (GQueue *queue, GFunc func, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Calls func for each element in the queue passing user_data to the function.
It is safe for func to remove the element from queue , but it must not modify any part of the queue after that element.

entry.para: the function to call for each element's data
user data to pass to func

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_find ()
refsect2.para: Finds the first link in queue which contains data .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the first link in queue which contains data

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_find_custom ()
refsect2.programlisting: GList * g_queue_find_custom (GQueue *queue, gconstpointer data, GCompareFunc func);
refsect2.para: Finds an element in a GQueue, using a supplied function to find the desired element. It iterates over the queue, calling the given function which should return 0 when the desired element is found. The function takes two gconstpointer arguments, the GQueue element's data as the first argument and the given user data as the second argument.

entry.para: a GCompareFunc to call for each element. It should return 0 when the desired element is found

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the found link, or NULL if it wasn't found

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_sort ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_queue_sort (GQueue *queue, GCompareDataFunc compare_func, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Sorts queue using compare_func .

entry.para: the GCompareDataFunc used to sort queue . This function is passed two elements of the queue and should return 0 if they are equal, a negative value if the first comes before the second, and a positive value if the second comes before the first.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_push_head ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new element at the head of the queue.

entry.para: the data for the new element.

refsect2.title: g_queue_push_tail ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new element at the tail of the queue.

entry.para: the data for the new element

refsect2.title: g_queue_push_nth ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_queue_push_nth (GQueue *queue, gpointer data, gint n);
refsect2.para: Inserts a new element into queue at the given position.

entry.para: the data for the new element
the position to insert the new element. If n is negative or larger than the number of elements in the queue , the element is added to the end of the queue.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_pop_head ()
refsect2.para: Removes the first element of the queue and returns its data.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the data of the first element in the queue, or NULL if the queue is empty

refsect2.title: g_queue_pop_tail ()
refsect2.para: Removes the last element of the queue and returns its data.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the data of the last element in the queue, or NULL if the queue is empty

refsect2.title: g_queue_pop_nth ()
refsect2.para: Removes the n 'th element of queue and returns its data.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the element's data, or NULL if n is off the end of queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_peek_head ()
refsect2.para: Returns the first element of the queue.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the data of the first element in the queue, or NULL if the queue is empty

refsect2.title: g_queue_peek_tail ()
refsect2.para: Returns the last element of the queue.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the data of the last element in the queue, or NULL if the queue is empty

refsect2.title: g_queue_peek_nth ()
refsect2.para: Returns the n 'th element of queue .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the data for the n 'th element of queue , or NULL if n is off the end of queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_index ()
refsect2.para: Returns the position of the first element in queue which contains data .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the position of the first element in queue which contains data , or -1 if no element in queue contains data

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_remove ()
refsect2.para: Removes the first element in queue that contains data .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if data was found and removed from queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_remove_all ()
refsect2.para: Remove all elements whose data equals data from queue .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the number of elements removed from queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_insert_before ()
refsect2.para: Inserts data into queue before sibling .
sibling must be part of queue . Since GLib 2.44 a NULL sibling pushes the data at the tail of the queue.

entry.para: a GList link that must be part of queue , or NULL to push at the tail of the queue.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_insert_after ()
refsect2.para: Inserts data into queue after sibling .
sibling must be part of queue . Since GLib 2.44 a NULL sibling pushes the data at the head of the queue.

entry.para: a GList link that must be part of queue , or NULL to push at the head of the queue.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_insert_sorted ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_queue_insert_sorted (GQueue *queue, gpointer data, GCompareDataFunc func, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Inserts data into queue using func to determine the new position.

entry.para: the GCompareDataFunc used to compare elements in the queue. It is called with two elements of the queue and user_data . It should return 0 if the elements are equal, a negative value if the first element comes before the second, and a positive value if the second element comes before the first.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_push_head_link ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new element at the head of the queue.

entry.para: a single GList element, not a list with more than one element

refsect2.title: g_queue_push_tail_link ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new element at the tail of the queue.

entry.para: a single GList element, not a list with more than one element

refsect2.title: g_queue_push_nth_link ()
refsect2.para: Inserts link into queue at the given position.

entry.para: the position to insert the link. If this is negative or larger than the number of elements in queue , the link is added to the end of queue .
the link to add to queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_pop_head_link ()
refsect2.para: Removes and returns the first element of the queue.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GList element at the head of the queue, or NULL if the queue is empty

refsect2.title: g_queue_pop_tail_link ()
refsect2.para: Removes and returns the last element of the queue.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GList element at the tail of the queue, or NULL if the queue is empty

refsect2.title: g_queue_pop_nth_link ()
refsect2.para: Removes and returns the link at the given position.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the n 'th link, or NULL if n is off the end of queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_peek_head_link ()
refsect2.para: Returns the first link in queue .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the first link in queue , or NULL if queue is empty

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_peek_tail_link ()
refsect2.para: Returns the last link in queue .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the last link in queue , or NULL if queue is empty

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_peek_nth_link ()
refsect2.para: Returns the link at the given position

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the link at the n 'th position, or NULL if n is off the end of the list

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_link_index ()
refsect2.para: Returns the position of link_ in queue .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the position of link_ , or -1 if the link is not part of queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_unlink ()
refsect2.para: Unlinks link_ so that it will no longer be part of queue . The link is not freed.
link_ must be part of queue .

entry.para: a GList link that must be part of queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_queue_delete_link ()
refsect2.para: Removes link_ from queue and frees it.
link_ must be part of queue .

entry.para: a GList link that must be part of queue

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: struct GQueue
refsect2.para: Contains the public fields of a Queue.

entry.para: a pointer to the first element of the queue
a pointer to the last element of the queue
the number of elements in the queue

refsect2.title: G_QUEUE_INIT
refsect2.para: A statically-allocated GQueue must be initialized with this macro before it can be used. This macro can be used to initialize a variable, but it cannot be assigned to a variable. In that case you have to use g_queue_init().
Since: 2.14
